metadata.label: Big Tech Companies (FAANG+)
metadata.description: Large established tech companies with structured processes

learningPathTweaks.title: Learning Path Optimized for Big Tech Success
learningPathTweaks.subtitle: What you need to excel at FAANG and similar companies

phaseAdaptations.note: Big Tech screens heavily on fundamentals and problem-solving - this is critical

addResources: Papers: Google, Amazon, Uber technical architecture
phaseAdaptations.note: System design is weighted heavily in interviews - deep mastery required

addResources: Company values and culture deep dive
phaseAdaptations.note: Behavioral interviews carry significant weight - don't underestimate

areas.description: Can you solve complex problems efficiently?
areas.emphasis: LeetCode Medium-Hard level problems, time and space complexity analysis

areas.description: Can you design systems that scale to billions of users?
areas.emphasis: Distributed systems, trade-offs, real-world architecture decisions
Specifics of your chosen role, not just surface knowledge

areas.description: Can you explain complex ideas clearly?
areas.emphasis: Clear explanations, asking clarifying questions, discussing trade-offs

areas.description: Do you align with company values?

roleExpectations.title: What You'll Do at Big Tech
responsibilities: Own well-defined projects within a larger system
Contribute to team efficiency and reliability
Work on problems with massive scale
Follow established processes and best practices

reasoning: Big Tech values algorithmic and system design thinking
Clear career progression and learning opportunities
whatYouNeed: Ability to handle interview process rigor

timelineAdjustment.explanation: Big Tech interviews are thorough and competitive - expect longer prep time

estimatedTimeToHire.explanation: From current level to being job-ready for a Big Tech role

commonChallengesAndTips.tip: Practice LeetCode problems daily - aim for 30-60 min per day
Study real systems (Google, Amazon, Uber papers) and understand decisions
Prepare for 4-6 rounds of interviews - mentally prepare for marathon
You're competing with strong candidates - consistency over speed matters
Practice your stories using STAR method - behavioral can make or break

successStories: Strong fundamentals + system design depth = Big Tech success
Companies hire engineers who think big and code well
The investment in prep pays off in career growth and compensation
